Plymouth were dealt a sickening blow on Good Friday as a controversial late penalty denied the Pilgrims a point against play-off contenders Middlesbrough. Defeats for Derby and Cardiff have kept Miron...

arts.ttl: Michael Carrick's play-off race admission after Middlesbrough's 'massive' late win
arts.sum: But finding a way to win, Boro won a penalty in stoppage time, with Conway stepping up in the high-pressure moment and calmly slotting the ball home to secure three massive points for his side. Michael Carrick admits Tommy Conway’s late goal for Middlesbrough was ‘massive’ for their hopes of making the top-six this season.

arts.ttl: Middlesbrough raise play-off hopes with Conway’s late winner against Plymouth
arts.sum: The victory leaves Boro just three points adrift of the top six with three games remaining.

arts.ttl: Late Tommy Conway penalty keeps Boro's top-six hopes alive in Plymouth win
arts.sum: Instead, adding to Finn Azaz’s early opener, Conway stayed calm under immense pressure and fired Boro to three huge points that keeps their season and play-off aspirations alive. Far too easy, one huge Plymouth clearance saw Ryan Hardie run off Jonny Howson and through on goal, with the Boro skipper unable to keep up.

arts.ttl: Morgan Whittaker advice as Middlesbrough man prepares for emotional Plymouth Argyle reunion
arts.sum: Michael Carrick says Morgan Whittaker must be cold about his emotions and feelings towards Plymouth Argyle and head coach Miron Muslic in order to have the best possible opportunity of performing well on Friday. Whittaker joined Boro from Plymouth in January in a £6 million deal but it was not without some controversy.

There will be just two games and six points left to play for by that point, meaning this weekend could quite literally make or break Boro’s season.

arts.ttl: James Wilson and fellow Scotland starlet pen new Hearts contracts
arts.sum: Jambos boss Critchley said: “It’s great news that both James and Adam have committed their futures to the club. Rising Scotland stars James Wilson and Adam Forrester have both signed new contracts with Hearts .
